greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of e.g.f. exp(exp(x) - Sum_{i=0..k} x^i/i!).
comment: A(n,k) is the number of set partitions of [n] into blocks of size > k.
link: E. A. Enneking and J. C. Ahuja, Generalized Bell numbers, Fib. Quart., 14 (1976), 67-73.
formula: E.g.f. of column k: Product_{i>k} exp(x^i/i!).
A(0,k) = 1, A(1,k) = A(2,k) = ... = A(k,k) = 0 and A(n,k) = Sum_{i=k..n-1} binomial(n-1,i)*A(n-1-i,k) for n > k.
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(
seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..14);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 28 2017
mathematica: A[n_, k_] /; 0 <= k <= n := A[n, k] = Sum[A[n-j, k] Binomial[n-1, j-1], {j, k+1, n}];
Table[A[n-k, k], {n, 0, 11}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 06 2019 *)
program: (1..n).each{|i| ary << (k..i - 1).inject(0){|s, j| s + ncr(i - 1, j) * ary[-1 - j]}}
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Sep 28 2017
